result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Stancil

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

8:48 AM   File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James E Stancil in court by zoom with attorney Mark Emil Kershek by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Kershek requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

dated 06-01-2022 from Attorney Mark Kershek, requesting to reschedule the 07-01-2022 hearing;  
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 06-01-2022:  granted.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Repayment at the rate of $25.00 per week. (BC)  
**forwarded to Circuit Court Business Center on 05-17-2022 (mjs)

Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (except for incidental contact while in the apartment building) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

09:33 AM Defendant James E Stancil in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  The Court utilizes the Petition for Appointed of Counsel in Waukesha County Case 21CM1968, as the Defendant states his financial status has not substantially change.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $25.00 per week commencing June 4, 2022.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A PAYMENT PLAN.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
